Menhub Beberkan 3 Posisi Direksi Sriwijaya Air Dirombak
07 Nov 2019, 15:37 by Trio Hamdani


Menhub Budi Karya Sumadi/Foto: Usman Hadi/detikcom

Jakarta - Menteri Perhubungan (Menhub) Budi Karya Sumadi mengatakan ada pergantian direksi di Sriwijaya Air. Perubahan susunan organisasi ini menyusul kerja sama Sriwijaya Air dengan Garuda Indonesia dilanjutkan setelah sempat berhenti."(Struktur organisasi) sebagian yang sudah ada, diganti beberapa saja," kata Budi di Gedung Transmedia, Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019).Menurut Budi direksi yang diganti adalah mereka yang khusus menangani masalah SDM, perawatan pesawat, dan operasional. Cuma, dia mengaku belum tahu identitas penggantinya.Perubahan direksi tersebut merupakan kesepakatan Garuda Indonesia dan Sriwijaya Air dan berlaku mulai Kamis ini."Per hari ini. Saya nggak tahu personilnya siapa tapi hari ini di-settle (ditetapkan). Direktur SDM, Direktur Maintenance sama Direktur Operasi," terang mantan Dirut PT Angkasa Pura II itu.Budi berharap orang-orang baru di tubuh Sriwijaya Air bisa membuat pelayanan penerbangan menjadi lebih baik. Selain itu Budi Berharap Sriwijaya Air memenuhi hak-hak penumpang yang penerbangannya hari ini tertunda. Jika tidak, maka siap-siap Sriwijaya Air akan kena sanksi"Aturannya sudah ada, kalau tidak terbang mesti bayar berapa, kalau delay harus gimana. Itu yang harus dia penuhi dan kita akan mengenakan sanksi apabila penerbangan tidak menjalankan apa-apa yang diregulasikan itu," kata Budi di Gedung Transmedia, Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019).Ketentuan tersebut diatur dalam Peraturan Menteri (PM) 89 Tahun 2015 tentang Penanganan Keterlambatan Penerbangan (Delay Management) pada Badan Usaha Angkutan Udara Niaga Berjadwal di Indonesia.Di situ ditegaskan penumpang dapat melakukan proses penjadwalan ulang kembali penerbangan, pengembalian biaya tiket (refund) serta apabila terjadi keterlambatan penerbangan juga ditangani sesuai dengan ketentuan delay management yang telah diatur sesuai ketentuan."Saya pikir itu adalah tanggung jawab daripada maskapai kepada penumpang," sebutnya. Minister of Transportation Describes 3 Directors Position of Sriwijaya Air Remodeled
Nov 7 2019, 15:37 by Trio Hamdani


Menhub Budi Karya Sumadi / Photo: Usman Hadi / detikcom

Jakarta - Minister of Transportation (Menhub) Budi Karya Sumadi said there was a change of directors in Sriwijaya Air. The change in the composition of the organization follows Sriwijaya Air's collaboration with Garuda Indonesia and continued after it had stopped. "(The organizational structure) some of which already existed, replaced only a few," said Budi at the Transmedia Building, Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019). The board of directors who were replaced were those who specifically handled HR, aircraft maintenance, and operational issues. Only, he claimed not to know the identity of his successor. The change of directors is an agreement between Garuda Indonesia and Sriwijaya Air and takes effect starting this Thursday. "As of today. I don't know who the personnel are but today it has been set. HR Director, Maintenance Director the same as Director of Operations, "explained the former Managing Director of PT Angkasa Pura II. Budi hopes that the new people in the body of Sriwijaya Air can make flight services better. In addition, Budi Hopes that Sriwijaya Air fulfills the rights of passengers whose flights were delayed today. If not, then get ready Sriwijaya Air will be subject to sanctions "The rules are there, if you don't fly, you have to pay how much, if you delay what to do. That's what he has to fulfill and we will impose sanctions if the flight doesn't run what is regulated, "said Budi at the Transmedia Building, Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019). These provisions are regulated in Ministerial Regulation (PM) 89 of 2015 concerning Handling of Delay Management in the Scheduled Commercial Air Transport Business Entity in Indonesia. There asserted passengers can carry out the process of rescheduling flight return, refund of ticket costs (refund) and if there is a flight delay is also handled in accordance with the provisions of delay management that have been set according to the provisions. "I think it is the responsibility of the airline to the passenger," he said.
